text.__SUMMARY__: Conus luteus, the mud cone, is a species of predatory sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.The subspecies Conus luteus richardsae Röckel & Korn, 1992 has been raised to species level as Conus richardsae Röckel & Korn, 1992
text.Description: The size of an adult shell varies between 18 mm and 54 mm. The color of the shell is yellow, pink or purplish, encircled by chestnut lines which are mostly broken up into chestnut and white articulations, an irregular white band below the middle. The aperture is purplish, with a central white band.
text.Distribution: This species occurs in the demersal zone of the Pacific Ocean French Polynesia  and off the Tuamotus. It is very often confused with Kioconus (Isoconus) viola (Cernohorsky, 1977) ( The picture on this page is conus Viola , and with Kioconus (Isoconus) richardsae (Röckel & Korn, 1992)

George Brettingham Sowerby, I, II & III: their conchological publications and molluscan taxa. Zootaxa. 2189: 1–218

Tucker J.K. & Tenorio M.J. (2009) Systematic classification of Recent and fossil conoidean gastropods. Hackenheim: Conchbooks. 296 pp.
